sentences.sContent: Many journalists here choose to pigeon all but the most innocuous of stories.
sentences.sContent_eng: Many journalists here choose to pigeon all but the most innocuous of stories.
sentences.sCn: 除了平淡乏味的报道，这儿的新闻记者将一切通过鸽子传递出去。

sentences.sContent: As the name implies, pigeon is an awkward pose, and it happens to be the most challenging for me.
sentences.sContent_eng: As the name implies, pigeon is an awkward pose, and it happens to be the most challenging for me.
sentences.sCn: 顾名思义，鸽子式是一个很棘手的姿势，它对于我来说是最有挑战性的。

sentences.sContent: Start slow with forward bends and calf stretches, move on to pigeon pose and plow at the end.
sentences.sContent_eng: Start slow with forward bends and calf stretches, move on to pigeon pose and plow at the end.
sentences.sCn: 开始时缓慢的前倾伸展和小腿伸展，然后摆出鸽子的姿势再是犁头的姿势。

trans.tranOther: a grey bird with short legs that is common in cities
